file_insights.impact: Direct schema change affecting all meeting mock objects

patterns_discovered.description: Replaced dual time fields (startTime, endTime) with single scheduledDate field
patterns_discovered.significance: Indicates API schema refactoring toward simpler timestamp representation

patterns_discovered.description: All three meeting mock objects updated uniformly with no exceptions

gotchas_discovered.description: By replacing startTime and endTime with single scheduledDate, the meeting duration information is lost in the mock data
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Ensure application code doesn't rely on duration calculation from mock meeting objects, or endTime should be preserved separately

gotchas_discovered.description: Only mock data was updated; actual API schema and other components need verification to ensure they support the new scheduledDate field
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Verify Meeting interface/type definition matches the new schema

approach_outcome.notes: Straightforward schema refactoring completed successfully on first attempt

recommendations.rationale: Type definition must match the new mock data structure to prevent compilation errors
recommendations.action: Check and update frontend/src/types/Meeting.ts or equivalent type definition

recommendations.recommendation: Audit component usage of meeting time fields
recommendations.rationale: Components may expect startTime/endTime fields for duration calculations or display
recommendations.action: Search codebase for references to startTime and endTime on meeting objects

recommendations.recommendation: Consider adding endTime back if duration is needed
recommendations.rationale: Current mock data loses duration information that may be required for display or calculations
recommendations.action: Evaluate if meeting duration/endTime should be added alongside scheduledDate

recommendations.rationale: Schema change should be documented for other developers
recommendations.action: Update API docs, README, or type definitions to reflect scheduledDate field
